comments:
When trying to fetch the platform feature from either the "3.3 Milestones" or the "Eclipse Nevada Test" update sites, I get a

java.lang.SecurityException: SHA1 digest error for lib/ant-antlr.jar
	at sun.security.util.ManifestEntryVerifier.verify(ManifestEntryVerifier.java:196)
	at java.util.jar.JarVerifier.processEntry(JarVerifier.java:201)
	at java.util.jar.JarVerifier.update(JarVerifier.java:188)
	at java.util.jar.JarVerifier$VerifierStream.read(JarVerifier.java:403)
	at java.io.InputStream.read(InputStream.java:89)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.UpdateManagerUtils.copy(UpdateManagerUtils.java:934)

I'm trying to install the feature manually by retrieving it from the update site, the calling site.install( feature, null, new NullProgressMonitor()) on a local extension site. 
This works without fail for the Eclipse 3.2.1 update site.

What version of eclipse are you currently running?
What vm are you using?
What build are you trying to update to?

First things first: JVM is Sun 1.5_08.

The remainder of your questions is not as simple to answer. 
I'm not running eclipse itself, rather writing an RCP App that - as part of the Eclipse Packaging Project - is using the update manager to fetch features/plugins from given sites. As such, I'm not trying to update from anything, just installing features to a clean local extension location. 
The features I tried to download were platform, sdk, jdt, pde from the 20061012/3.3 M4 build on the milestone site, as well as the same features from the 20070213/Integration build on the Nevada site.

The application runs fine when built on either Eclipse 3.2.1 or Eclipse 3.3 M5 and using 3.2.1 features, the problem appears only when I try to contact the update sites mentioned or mirrors thereof.

I have no idea because I can't replicate this problem since I don't run the RCP app you describe.

I would suggest asking on the eclipse.platform group, and am moving this bug to platform update for comment.

Alright, thank you.
I'll pose additional questions there once the code in question is available from public CVS, which should be sometime this week.
